intro: Haplothismia exannulata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rock cress, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many edible and economically important plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in dry, sunny environments. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. Haplothismia exannulata is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
